subject: Re: accessing JUnit runner/suite objects at runtime (or... rule for a suite)
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I have a custom Suite class.  That approach sounds great. But how can I access the test cases within the suite? This is my Suite class: /** * Test
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Steve,
>
> Do you have a custom Suite class? You could use that to loop through
> the included test cases and validate each one.
>
> David Saff

Yes, I have a custom Suite class. That approach sounds great.

But how can I access the test cases within the suite?


This is my Suite class:

/**
* Test suite to run all tests annotated with
* @Category(FailingTests.class)
*/
@IncludeCategory(FailingTests.class)
@RunWith(Categories.class)
@SuiteClasses(AllTests.class)
public class FailingTests { }

and the AllTests Suite is:

@RunWith(ClasspathSuite.class)
public class AllTests { }
